page.title: Operations Toolbar
page.introduction: The buttons shown in this toolbar allow the user to perform various useful operations on selected entities within the Pathway Diagram View and the Pathway Objects View .
page.appearance: This toolbar shows buttons allowing group, delete and link operations on selected entities. There is also present a Search feature which filters entities by string.
page.operations:
The user can perform various operations upon these entities, either on individually selected entities or multiple selected entities.
Multiple entities can be grouped together under a Group entity. The goal of such action would be to reduce clutter and allow the user to focus on the significant parts of the view. Consider the view below:
The user may choose to group all the linked items (those marked with a 'L' letter) under a group and all the participants of the other reaction under a second group. The result should look as follows:
Existing groups can be grouped in even larger groups. Also groups can be broken down into their original subcomponents using the Ungroup option.
A particular type of grouping applies to reactions. The Collapse / Expand commands will hide / restore the entities associated with a selected reaction.
Single / multiple entities can be deleted from the view using the Delete Selected button. Note that linked entities cannot be deleted as long as the link exists. In the case of selections where some entities can be deleted and some others can not, a warning dialog box will display pertinent information.
Single / multiple entities can be imported within a model. To do this select one or more entities and press the Physiology Links button, then the option Import into physiology...
The Import into physiology Dialog box is opened. Here the user is allowed to edit the default values for the compartment and stoichiometric coefficient. Once that step is finished the imported entities are displayed within the Reaction Diagram View .
Returning to the Pathway Diagram View it can be noticed that the linked entities display a small 'L' mark within their circle representation, indicating their linked status.
